metadata.title: CVE-2022-1529 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An attacker could have sent a message to the parent process where thecontents were used to double-index into a JavaScript object, leading toprototype pollution and ultimately attacker-controlled JavaScript executingin the privileged parent process. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR <91.9.1, Firefox < 100.0.2, Firefox for Android < 100.3.0, and Thunderbird <91.9.1.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
